content.description: Begin up a hand and fist crack up and into a steep roof and ending in an offwidth section.

climbs.name: Sundowner
climbs.fa: P1: Bob Kutch, Brian Smith 5-94  P2: Pat Brennan, Eric Tipton 10-97

content.description: Can be climbed in one pitch with a 60 meter rope, five quick draws, and a couple of cams if you don't like runnouts. This is a fun climb and a great way to reach the very top of the Skull. Pitch one (5.8) starts up a slabby face with some suspect rock to a high first bolt, head right for the 2nd just below the roof and make the crux move up and over to the 3rd bolt. From here medium to small cams can be used to protect the moves up a heavily featured face, either head right for an easier finish or climb directly up the face. Pitch two (5.9) begins off the block onto an overhanging roof (the crux). Slab climb past this to the summit. Rap off the anchors shared with Mr. No Show and walk around east to the base of pitch one.
content.protection: 5 bolts, optional medium to small cams, 2 bolt chain anchor.
content.location: Right and down from Mr. No Show.

content.description: A steep face route up a fun, highly featured face.
content.location: Though technically west facing this wall is easier accessed by heading all the way up the east face slabs and then turning west before HB's.

climbs.name: Mr. No Show
climbs.fa: Eric Tipton, Pat Brennan, Kenn Kenaga, Jeff Rivera

content.description: The first pitch goes at 5.9 and is a hand and fist crack to a large ledge. The second pitch is an offwidth and squeeze chimney to the top of the Skull formation.
content.location: North end of the west face.

content.description: A fun two bolt climb right of Neoprene Man.
content.location: Though technically west facing this wall is easier accessed by heading all the way up the east face slabs and then turning west before HB's.
